src: Sørg for at hånden din er så rolig som mulig samtidig som at du fortsatt kan treffe alle tonene riktig – forsøk i tillegg å ikke foreta overflødige bevegelser med fingrene. På denne måten kommer du ikke til å slite deg ut like mye. Husk at det ikke er behov for å treffe tangentene med mye kraft for ekstra volum, som på pianoet. For å få ekstra lyd på et trekkspill, kan du bruke belgen med mer trykk eller fart.
mt: 1. Make sure your hand is as still as possible while still being able to hit all the notes correctly. Try not to make unnecessary movements with your fingers. This way you won't tire yourself out as much. Remember that you don't need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume, as on a piano. To get extra sound on a keyboard, you can use the pedal with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Når man forsøker å gjøre en video om til DVD-format, så er overscan et av de alminnelige problemene. De fleste TV-er er laget for å være til glede for folk generelt. På grunn av dette har alt du ser på TV-en kuttede kanter, på både topp, bunn og sider. Dette gjøres for å sikre at bildet dekker hele skjermen, også kalt overskanning. Når man lager en DVD, vil ytterkantene mest sannsynlig bli kuttet bort, og hvis videoen har undertekster for nær bunnen vil de ikke bli fullstendig vist.
mt: When you try to convert a video to DVD format, overscan is one of the common problems. Most TVs are made to be enjoyed by the general public. Because of this, everything you see on the TV has cut edges, both top, bottom and sides. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen, also called overscan. When you make a DVD, the outer edges will most likely be cut off, and if the video has subtitles near the bottom they will not be fully displayed.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Den amerikanske planen var nødt til å kunne sette i gang koordinerte angrep fra 3 ulike retninger. General John Cadwalder startet et avledningsangrep mot den britiske garnisonen ved Bordentown, for å stoppe eventuelle forsterkninger. General James Ewing hadde planlagt å frakte milits på 700 over elva ved Trenton Ferry, beslaglegge broen over Assunpink Creek og hindre eventuelle fiendtlige tropper i å flykte. For å kunne starte et angrep før daggry, måtte hovedangrepsstyrken som var på 2400 menn krysse elva nesten 14,5 km nord for Trenton. Deretter delte de seg opp i to grupper, én under Greene og den andre under Sullivan.
mt: The American plan was to be able to launch coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder started a diversion attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, to prevent any reinforcements. General James Ewing had planned to ferry 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from fleeing. To be able to launch an attack before dawn, the main attack force of 2400 men had to cross the river about 14.5 km north of Trenton. They then split into two groups, one under Greene and the other under Sullivan.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Et håndskrevet utkast underskrevet av kongressens president John Hancock og generalsekretær Charles Thomson og så sendt noen kvartaler unna til trykkeriet til John Dunlap etter dens innføring av Kongressen den 4. juli. Mellom 150 og 200 eksemplarer ble laget gjennom natten og disse er nå kjent som «Dunlap-bredsidene». Den første offentlige lesingen av dokumentet var ved John Nixon i hagen til uavhengighetshallen den 8. juli. Den ene kom til George Washington den 6. juli, som fikk den opplest til sine tropper i New York den 9. juli. En kopi ankom London den 10. august. De 25 Dunlap-bredsidene man fortsatt vet finnes, er de eldste overlevende kopiene av dokumentet. Den første kopien som ble skrevet for hånd har ikke overlevd.
mt: A handwritten draft signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson and then sent a few blocks away to the printer John Dunlap after its adoption by Congress on July 4. Between 150 and 200 copies were made through the night and these are now known as the "Dunlap broadsides". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of the Independence Hall on July 8. One copy reached George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The first copy written by hand has not survived.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Kolonistene hadde i tillegg bedt om forsterkning når de så denne aktiviteten. Tropper forsterker de fremre stillingene inkludert 1. og 3. New Hampshire-regiment på 200 menn, under John Stark og James Reed (begge ble senere generaler). Mennene til Stark plasserte seg langs gjerdet på nordenden av kolonistenes posisjon. Lavvannet åpnet et mellomrom langs Mystic-elva langs nordøst på halvøya slik at de måtte forlenge gjerdet hurtig med en kort mur av stein, til nordenden ved vannkanten på en liten strand. Gridley eller Stark satte en påle omtrent 100 britiske fot (30 m) foran gjerdet og ga ordre til at ingen skulle skyte før de regulære hadde passert den.
mt: The colonists had also asked for reinforcements when they saw this activity. Troops were reinforcing the forward positions including the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under John Stark and James Reed (both later generals). Stark's men placed themselves along the fence at the north end of the colonists' position. The low water opened a gap along Mystic River on the northeast of the peninsula so they had to quickly extend the fence with a short wall of stone to the north end at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark set a pole about 100 British feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered no one to shoot until the regulars had passed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Antikkens Kina hadde en unik måte å vise ulike tidsperioder ; hver fase av Kina eller hver familie som hadde makten, var et særpreget dynasti. Også mellom hvert dynasti var en ustabil alder av delte provinser. De beste-kjente i disse periodene var de tre Kongedømmene som tar plass i 60 år mellom Han og Jin Dynastiet. I løpet av disse periodene var det voldsom krigføring mellom mange konger som slåss om tronen. De tre Kongedømmene var en av de blodigste epokene i antikkens Kinas historie da tusenvis av mennesker døde mens de kjempet for å sitte i høysetet i det store palasset ved Xiadel.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each phase of China or each family that had power, was a unique dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods were the Three Kingdoms that take place in 60 years between the Han and Jin Dynasties. During these periods there was fierce warring between many kings who fought for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest epochs in ancient China's history as thousands of people died while they fought to sit in the high seat in the great palace at Xiadel.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Vandremaurens kolonier marsjerer og hekker også i ulike faser. I løpet av den nomadiske fasen marsjerer vandremaur om natten og stopper opp for å slå leir i løpet av dagen. Kolonien går inn i en nomadefase når tilgangen på mat blir redusert. I denne fasen lager kolonien midlertidige reder som endrer seg hver dag. Hver enkelt av disse nomadiske herjingene eller marsjene pågår i ca. 17 dager.
mt: The colonies of wandering ants march and nest also in different phases. During the nomadic phase, wandering ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony goes into a nomadic phase when the supply of food is reduced. In this phase, the colony creates temporary nests that change every day. Each of these nomadic raids or marches lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Mange rytmer som kan sees i fysiologi og oppførsel er som regel helt avhengig av tilstedeværelsen av endogene sykluser og deres produksjon gjennom biologiske klokker. Det har blitt påvist periodiske rytmer fra så og si alle levende vesener, inkludert bakterier, sopp, planter og dyr, og da ikke bare som reaksjoner på ytre periodiske signaler. Biologiske klokker er selvgående oscillatorer som opprettholder en periode med selvstendige sykluser uten ytre påvirkning.
mt: Many rhythms that can be seen in physiology and behavior are usually completely dependent on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. It has been observed periodic rhythms from so to say all living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants and animals, and not just as reactions to external periodic signals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that maintain a period with independent cycles without external influence.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: En befolkning er en gruppe organismer innenfor en bestemt art på en spesifikk geografisk plass. Når alle enkeltpersoner i en befolkning er identiske når det gjelder et spesielt fenotypisk trekk, er de kjent som monomorfiske. Når personene viser flere varianter av en bestemt egenskap, er de polymorfiske.
mt: A population is a group of organisms within a particular species on a specific geographic place. When all individuals in a population are identical in terms of a specific phenotypic trait, they are known as monomorphic. When individuals show multiple variants of a particular trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Naturbasert turisme tiltrekker seg mennesker som vil besøke naturområder for å nyte landskapet, inkludert plante- og dyrelivet. Eksempler på stedsaktiviteter innebærer jakt, fiske, fotografering, se på fugler, dra til parker og undersøke detaljer om økosystemet. Et eksempel er besøk, fotografering og læring om orangutanger på Borneo.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people who want to visit natural areas to enjoy the landscape, including plant and animal life. Examples of place activities include hunting, fishing, photography, watching birds, visiting parks and studying details of the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing and learning about orangutans on Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Hver morgen kjører folk i bil for komme seg på jobb utenfor landsbyen, mens andre kjører i motsatt retning fordi deres arbeidsplass er i landsbyen de andre kjører ut av. I denne dynamiske transportfarkosten er alle på et eller annet vis tilknyttet, og tilhengere av, et transportsystem som er basert på privatbiler. Vitenskapen viser at den store karbonøkonomien har løsnet biosfæren fra en stabil tilstand som har støttet menneskeevolusjon de siste to millioner årene.
mt: Every morning people drive to work outside the village, while others drive in the opposite direction because their workplace is in the village they drive out of. In this dynamic transport system, everyone is in some way connected to and a supporter of a transport system based on private cars. Science shows that the great carbon economy has released the biosphere from a stable state that has supported human evolution for the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atomet kan anses for å være en av de fundamentale byggesteinene i all materie. Det er en komplisert enhet som, ifølge en forenklet Bohr-modell, er en sentral nukleus av elektroner, litt lignende for planetene i banen rundt solen – se figur 1.1. Nøytroner og protoner utgjør kjernen. Protonene har en positiv elektrisk ladning mens nøytroner har ingen ladning. Elektroner har en negativ elektrisk ladning.
mt: The atom can be considered one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. It is a complex unit which, according to a simplified Bohr model, is a central nucleus of electrons, somewhat similar to the planets in orbit around the sun – see Figure 1.1. Neutrons and protons make up the nucleus. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Så og si nesten alle PC-er som benyttes i dag, baseres på manipulering av informasjon som er kodet med binære tall. Et binært tall kan kun ha én av to verdier, dvs. 0 eller 1. Disse tallene omtales som binærsifre – eller biter, for å bruke datasjargon.
mt: Almost all PCs in use today are based on manipulating information encoded with binary numbers. A binary number can only have one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1. These numbers are called binary digits – or bits, to use data jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Blogger kan også bidra til å forbedre studentskriving. Selv om studenter ofte begynner sin bloggopplevelse med slurvete grammatikk og staving, vil tilstedeværelsen av et publikum generelt forandre på det. Bloggforfatteren begynte å forbedre skrivingen sin for å slippe kritikk, ettersom elever ofte er det mest kritiske publikummet. Også blogging «tvinger studenter til å bli mer oppdatert på verden rundt seg». Behovet for å gi det som ønskes til publikumet inspirerer studenter til å være smarte og interessante (Toto, 2004). Blogging er et verktøy som motiverer til å jobbe sammen, og oppfordrer elever til å utvide sin læreevne utover den typiske skoledagen de er vandt med. Passende bruk av blogger «kan hjelpe elever til å tenke mer analytisk og kritisk; gjennom å reagere aktivt på internettmaterialer, kan elevene definere sine posisjoner i sammenheng med andre, samt skissere sine egne perspektiver på spesielle problemstillinger» (Oravec, 2002).
mt: Bloggers can also contribute to improving student writing. Although students often begin their blogging experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Bloggers began to improve their writing to avoid criticism, as students are often the most critical audience. Also, blogging “forces students to be more up-to-date on the world around them.” The need to give what is wanted to the audience inspires students to be smart and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that motivates to work together, and encourages students to expand their learning beyond the typical school day they are stuck with. Appropriate use of bloggers “can help students to think more analytically and critically; by reacting actively to Internet materials, students can define their positions in relation to others, and sketch their own perspectives on specific issues” (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Blogger kan også bidra til å forbedre studentskriving. Selv om studenter ofte begynner sin bloggopplevelse med slurvete grammatikk og staving, vil tilstedeværelsen av et publikum generelt forandre på det. Bloggforfatteren begynte å forbedre skrivingen sin for å slippe kritikk, ettersom elever ofte er det mest kritiske publikummet. Også blogging «tvinger studenter til å bli mer oppdatert på verden rundt seg». Behovet for å gi det som ønskes til publikumet inspirerer studenter til å være smarte og interessante (Toto, 2004). Blogging er et verktøy som motiverer til å jobbe sammen, og oppfordrer elever til å utvide sin læreevne utover den typiske skoledagen de er vandt med. src: Asynkron kommunikasjon oppmuntrer til å ta seg tid til å reflektere og til samhandling med andre. Det gjør at elever får mulighet til å arbeide i sitt eget tempo og styre tempoet på instruksjonsinformasjonen. Det er også mindre tidsbegrensninger, og det er mulig med mer varierte arbeidstider. (Bremer, 1998) Bruken av Internett og verdensveven gir lærende tilgang til informasjon til enhver tid. I stedet for å vente til neste gang de møtes ansikt til ansikt kan elever sende inn spørsmål til instruktørene når som helst på dagen og få ganske rask respons.
mt: Asynchronous communication encourages taking time to reflect and to collaborate with others. It allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. There are also fewer time constraints, and more varied work hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web gives learners access to information at any time. Instead of waiting until the next time they meet face to face, students can send in questions to instructors at any time during the day and get quite quick responses.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Det tradisjonelle middelalderslottet har vært en inspirasjon for fantasi i lang tid, og tilkaller frem bilder av jousts, banketter og arthurian ridderlighet. Selv når man står midt i tusen år gamle ruiner er det lett å tenke seg til lyder og lukter fra kamper som fant sted for lenge siden, man kan nesten høre klakkende hover i spindelvevet og lukte frykten som stiger i fangehullet. Er fantasien vår derimot basert på virkelighet? Hvorfor ble slottene bygget i det hele tatt? Hvordan var de designet og bygget?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has been an inspiration for fantasy for a long time, and calls forth images of jousts, banquets and arthurian chivalry. Even when standing in the midst of a thousand year old ruins, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of battles that took place long ago, one can almost hear the clattering hooves in the spiderweb and smell the fear rising in the dungeon. Is our fantasy based on reality? Why were the castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Typisk for perioden, Kirby Muxloe Borgen er mer et forsterket hus enn et ekte slott. De store, innglassede vinduene og tynne veggene ville ikke klart å motsette seg et bestemt angrep lenge. På 1480-tallet, da byggingen ble startet av Lord Hastings, var landet relativt fredelig og det var bare nødvendig å forsvare seg mot små bander av småbanditter.
mt: Typical of the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more a fortified house than a true castle. The large, glazed windows and thin walls would not have stood up to a determined attack for long. In 1480, when construction was started by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and it was only necessary to defend against small bands of brigands.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Med endringen fra 400 til 800 meter, har hastigheten blitt av mindre betydning, mens utholdenhet er en absolutt nødvendighet. Selvsagt må en førsteklasses mann som løper en halvmil på mindre enn 2 minutter være utstyrt med en viss raskhet, men utholdenhet må dyrkes i enhver fare. En del terrengløping på vinterstid, i kombinasjon med gymarbeid for overkroppen, er den beste forberedelsen til løpesesongen.
mt: 400 to 800 meters, the speed has become less important, while endurance is an absolute necessity. Of course, a first-class man who runs a half-mile in less than two minutes must be equipped with a certain speed, but endurance must be cultivated in any danger. Some cross-country running in the winter, combined with gym work for the upper body, is the best preparation for the running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Ordentlig ernæringspraksis i seg selv er ikke nok til å generere eliteopptreden, men det kan i stor grad påvirke de unge utøvernes generelle velvære. Det å opprettholde en sunn energibalanse, praktisere effektive hydreringsvaner og forstå de ulike aspektene ved supplementerende øvelser, kan hjelpe utøvere med å forbedre sine prestasjoner og øke gleden over idretten.
mt: Proper nutrition in itself is not enough to generate elite performance, but it can greatly affect the young athletes' overall well-being. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits and understanding the different aspects of supplemental exercises can help athletes improve their performance and increase the joy of sports.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Mellomdistanseløsing er en ganske rimelig idrett; det er imidlertid mange misoppfatninger angående de få tingene som trengs for å delta. Produkter kan kjøpes ved behov, men de fleste produkter vil ha lite eller ingen reell påvirkning på ytelse. Selv om et produkt ikke gir noen reelle fordeler så føler kanskje idrettsfolk at de foretrekker det allikevel.
mt: 400 meter running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions about the few things needed to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most products will have little or no real impact on performance. Even if a product does not provide any real benefits, athletes may still prefer it.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MR er basert på et fysikk-fenomen kalt nukleærmagnetisk resonans (NMR), som ble oppdaget på 1930-tallet av Felix Bloch (Stanford) og Edvard Purcell (Harvard). Denne resonansen, det magnetiske feltet og radiobølgene fører til at atomer gir fra seg ørsmå radiosignaler. Raymond Damadian som er lege og forsker, oppdaget i år 1970 grunnlaget for å bruke magnetiske resonansbilder som et verktøy for å stille medisinske diagnoser. Fire år senere ble et patent innvilget, noe som var verdens første patent utstedt i feltet for MR. I 1977 gjorde Dr. Damadian ferdig utbyggingen av den første «helkropps»-MR-skanneren, som han gav navnet «den urokkelige».
mt: MR is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (Stanford) and Edward Purcell (Harvard). This resonance, the magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. Raymond Damadian, a physician and researcher, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance images as a tool for medical diagnosis in 1970. Four years later, a patent was granted, which was the first patent issued in the field of MR. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first "whole-body" MR scanner, which he named "the unflinching".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Mennesker er uten tvil den arten som er flinkest til å tolke andres tanker. Altså så kan vi forutsi hva andre personer oppfatter, har som hensikt, tror, kjenner til eller ønsker. Blant disse evnene er det å forstå andres hensikter avgjørende. Det gjør at vi kan løse mulige tvetydigheter rundt fysiske handlinger. Hvis du for eksempel ser at en person knuser et bilvindu, vil du trolig anta at han prøver å stjele noens bil. Han måtte ha blitt dømt på en annen måte dersom han hadde mistet bilnøklene og det faktisk var sitt eget kjøretøy han forsøkte å bryte seg inn i.
mt: It is without doubt that humans are the species that are best at interpreting others' thoughts. That is, we can predict what other people perceive, intend, believe, know, or want. Among these abilities, understanding others' intentions is crucial. If you see someone smashing a car window, you will likely assume that he is trying to steal someone's car. He would have been judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was actually his own vehicle that he was trying to break into.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Selv om kunstig intelligens AI gir en sterk følelse av science fiction, er AI en svært viktig gren av datavitenskapen, håndtering av atferd, læring og intelligent adaptasjon i en maskin. Forskning i kunstig intelligens handler om å lage maskiner til automatisering av oppgaver som behøver intelligent oppførsel. Eksempler omfatter kontroll og planlegging av muligheten til å svare på kundediagnoser og spørsmål, samt håndskriftsanalyse, stemme og ansikts gjenkjenning. Disse har blitt til separate disipliner som fokuserer på å komme med løsninger til virkelige livsproblemer. AI-systemet er nå ofte brukt på feltene i økonomi, medisin, ingeniørfag og forsvar, som er bygget i flere hjemmePC-er og dataspillprogramvare.
mt: Artificial intelligence (AI) gives a strong feeling of science fiction, but AI is a very important branch of computer science, handling of behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in artificial intelligence is about creating machines for automation of tasks that need intelligent behavior. Examples include diagnosis and answering customer questions, handwriting analysis, voice and face recognition. These have become separate disciplines that focus on coming up with solutions to real life problems. AI systems are now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and defense, which are built in several home PCs and computer game software.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Konvertering av tenkende mønstre er problemløsningsteknikker som forener ulike ideer eller felt for å finne en løsning. Fokuset i denne tankegangen er fart, logikk og nøyaktighet, i tillegg til identifisering av fakta, anvendelse av eksisterende metoder, informasjonsinnsamling. Det viktigste for dette tankesettet er: Det finnes bare ett riktig svar. Man tenker bare på to svar, nemlig det riktige eller det gal. Denne typen tenkning er knyttet til en viss standardprosedyre. Folk med denne tenketypen benytter en rasjonell metode når de tenker, og kan memorere mønstre, løse problemer og arbeide med vitenskapelige forsøk.
mt: Conversion of thinking patterns is problem solving techniques that combine different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus in this way of thinking is speed, logic and accuracy, in addition to identifying facts, use of existing methods, information collection. The most important for this mindset is: There is only one right answer. You only think of two answers, namely the right or the wrong. This type of thinking is connected to a certain standard procedure. People with this thinking type use a rational method when they think, and can memorize patterns, solve problems and work with scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Ved bruk av videoopptak har det blitt gjort betydningsfulle oppdagelser i tolkningen av mikrouttrykk, bevegelser i ansiktet som varer få millisekunder. Særlig har det blitt hevdet at man kan finne ut om en person lyger ved å tolke mikrouttrykk riktig. Oliver Sacks antyder i sin avis, The President's Tale, hvordan folk som ikke klarer å forstå tale på grunn av hjerneskade, er likevel i stand til å vurdere oppriktighet på korrekt måte. Han hevder også at slike evner til å forklare menneskelig atferd kan deles av dyr som for eksempel kjæledyrshunder.
mt: By using video recordings, important discoveries have been made in the interpretation of microexpressions, facial movements that last only a few milliseconds. It has been claimed that one can tell if a person is lying by correctly interpreting microexpressions. Oliver Sacks hints in his newspaper, The President's Tale, how people who cannot understand speech due to brain damage are nevertheless able to evaluate honesty correctly. He also claims that such abilities to explain human behavior can be shared by animals such as pet dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Siden evnen til å innhente kunnskap og å få opplæring endret seg som nevnt over, ble hastigheten over hvor raskt kunnskapen kunne innhentes endret. Måten å innhente informasjon på var annerledes. Trykket lå ikke lenger innenfor individuell tilbakekalling, men evnen til å tilbakekalle tekst ble et større fokus. Renessansen gjorde først og fremst en betydelig forandring i tilnærmingen til læring og formidling av kunnskap.
mt: Since the ability to acquire knowledge and to receive instruction changed as mentioned above, the speed at which knowledge could be acquired changed. The way to acquire information was different. The pressure was no longer within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became a greater focus. The Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Det er en kombinasjon av elementer med både masse- og interpersonlig kommunikasjon på internett. De spesielle kjennetegn ved internett fører til ekstra dimensjoner i forhold til bruks- og tilfredsstillelsestilnærmingen. For eksempel blir «læring» og «sosialisering» ansett som viktige motivasjonsfaktorer for internettbruk (James m. flere, 1995). Eighmey og McCord identifiserte også «personlig engasjement» og «vedvarende relasjoner» som nye motivasjon aspekter da de etterforsket publikums reaksjoner til nettsteder (1998).
mt: It is a combination of mass and interpersonal communication elements on the Internet. The special characteristics of the Internet lead to extra dimensions in relation to the use and satisfaction approach. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are considered important motivation factors for Internet use (James et al., 1995). Eighmey and McCord also identified "personal involvement" and "sustained relationships" as new motivation aspects when they investigated the public's reactions to websites (1998).
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotisk stil var på topp i perioden mellom 10.–11. århundre og det 14. århundre. I begynnelsen ble antrekk sterkt påvirket av Byzantine-kulturen i øst. Men grunnet trege kommunikasjonskanaler, kunne stiler i vesten henge etter med 25 - 30 år. Mot slutten av middelalderen startet Vest-Europa å skape sin egen stil. En av de største forandringene som kom på den tiden, og som et resultat av korstogene, var at personer begynte å benytte knapper til å lukke klesplagg.
mt: Gothic style was at its peak between the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th century. In the beginning, clothing was strongly influenced by Byzantine culture in the east. But due to slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 - 30 years. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to create its own style. One of the biggest changes that came at the time, and as a result of the Crusades, was that people began to use buttons to close clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Vi kan starte med å få en livsstil som er mer miljøvennlig, vi kan bli med på miljøbevegelsen, og vi kan også bli aktivister for å til en viss grad forminske kommende smerte. Dette er mange ganger akkurat som symptomatisk behandling. Men dersom vi ikke bare vil ha en midlertidig løsning, så bør vi finne roten til problemene, og fjerne dem. Verden har endret seg veldig fra menneskers vitenskapelige og teknologiske fremskritt, samt vanskeligheter har blitt mer kompliserte grunnet overbefolkning og menneskehetens ekstravagante livsstil.
mt: We can start by having a lifestyle that is more environmentally friendly, we can join the environmental movement, and we can also be activists to reduce the pain to some extent. This is many times exactly like symptomatic treatment. But if we are not just looking for a temporary solution, we should find the root of the problems, and remove them. The world has changed a lot from human scientific and technological progress, and difficulties have become more complicated due to overpopulation and the extravagant lifestyle of mankind.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Man har forsøkt å opprettholde suvereniteten i alle de europeiske statene ved hjelp av systemet med maktbalanse. Konseptet var at alle europeiske land var nødt til å søke for å hindre at ett land skulle bli mektig, og nasjonale regjeringer forandret derfor ofte sine allianser for å opprettholde balansen. Den spanske arvefølgekrigen markerte den første krigen hvis sentrale utspill var maktbalansen. Dette markerte en viktig endring, fordi europeiske styrker ikke lenger hadde påskuddet av å være religiøse kriger. Dermed ble 30-årskrigen den siste krigen som ble kalt en religiøs krig.
mt: The concept was that all European states were forced to seek to prevent one state from becoming powerful, and national governments changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The Spanish Succession War marked the first war whose central events were the balance of power. This marked an important change, because European forces no longer had the pretext of being religious warriors. Thus, the Thirty Years' War was the last war to be called a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Den katolske kirken som hadde blitt rik og mektig, ble gransket i løpet av denne perioden i europeisk historie. I tusenvis av år hadde kristendommen knyttet sammen europeiske stater til tross for forskjeller i språk og skikker. Dens altgjennomtrengende myndighet berørte alle, fra konge til vanlige folk. Et av de essensielle prinsippene for kristendommen er at rikdom skal benyttes til å forminske smerte og fattigdom og det er derfor pengemidlene til kirken er der. Kirkens sentrale myndigheten hadde vært i Roma i over tusen år og denne makt- og pengekonsentrasjonen fikk mange til å stille spørsmål ved om dette prinsippet ble fulgt.
mt: The Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, was scrutinized during this period in European history. For thousands of years, Christianity had united European states despite differences in language and customs. Its all-pervasive authority affected everyone, from king to commoner. One of the essential principles of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and so the Church's financial resources are there. The Church's central authority had been in Rome for over a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money caused many to question whether this principle was being followed.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Det vettskremte kongehuset, kong Ludvig XVI, dronning Marie Antoinette sammen med deres to unge barn (Marie Therese på 11 år og Ludvig-Charles på 4 år) og kongens søster, Madam Elizabeth, ble den 6. oktober 1789 presset til å komme tilbake til Paris fra Versailles av en folkemengde med markedskvinner. Kongen og dronningen reiste tilbake til Paris i en vogn omringet av en folkemengde som skrek og ropte trusler mot de. Folkegruppen tvang kongen og dronningen til å ha sine vogn-vinduer fullstendig åpne. Et medlem av banden svingte på et tidspunkt hodet til en kongelig vakt, drept på Versailles fremfor den skremte dronningen.
mt: 6 October 1789, the terrified royal family, King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette along with their two young children (Marie Therese at 11 years and Louis-Charles at 4 years) and the king's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced to return to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. The king and queen returned to Paris in a carriage surrounded by a mob who screamed and threatened them. The mob forced the king and queen to have their carriage windows completely open. At one point, a member of the mob swung his head at a royal guard, killed at Versailles before the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Kort tid etter utbruddet av fiendskap, begynte Storbritannia en marineblokade mot Tyskland. Strategien demonstrerte at effekten av å kutte vitale militære og sivile forsyninger, selv om blokaden krenket allment akseptert internasjonal lov som er kodifisert gjennom flere internasjonale avtaler de siste to århundrene. Storbritannia bombet internasjonalt farvann for å hindre at noen skip gikk inn i hele deler av hav, og skaper fare for selv nøytrale skip. Tyskland var forberedt på et tilsvarende svar på sin ubegrensede ubåtkrigføring ettersom det var begrenset respons på denne taktikken.
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain began a naval blockade against Germany. The strategy demonstrated that the effect of cutting vital military and civilian supplies, even if the blockade violated generally accepted international law as codified through several international treaties in the last two centuries. Britain bombed international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire parts of the sea, and creating danger for even neutral ships. Germany was prepared for a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare as it was limited response to this tactic.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Etter det vi vet så er det ca. 400 000 tilfeller av multippel sklerose (MS) over hele USA, noe som gjør det til den mest vanlige nevrologiske sykdommen hos yngre og middelaldrende voksne. MS er en sykdom som rammer det sentrale nervesystemet som inkluderer hjernen, ryggmargen og synsnerven. Forskning viser at kvinner har dobbelt så stor sjanse for å få MS enn menn.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are known to exist in the United States, making it the most common neurological disorder among younger and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve. Research shows that women have twice the chance of getting MS than men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Studiet oppdaget at depresjon, frykt og katastrofetenkning var en del av forholdet mellom smerte og funksjonsnedsettelse hos personer som lider av korsryggproblemer. Bare effekten av krisemaksimering, ikke depresjon og frykt, var betinget av jevnlige ukentlige strukturerte fysiske aktiviteter. De som deltar i jevnlig aktivitet krevde mer støtte i forhold til negativ oppfatning av smerte, med å kjenne hvordan kroniske smerter og ubehag som skyldes normal fysisk bevegelse føles.
mt: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophic thinking were part of the relationship between pain and functional impairment in people with back pain. Only the effect of crisis maximization, not depression and fear, was contingent on regular weekly structured physical activity. Those who participated in regular activity demanded more support in relation to negative perception of pain, feeling how chronic pain and discomfort due to normal physical activity feels.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Den moderne sporten fekting spilles på mange nivåer, fra studenter som lærer ved et universitet til faglig og OL-konkurranse. Idretten utøves først og fremst i et duellformat, en fekter duellerer med en annen.
mt: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students who learn at a university to professionally and at the Olympics. The sport is practiced primarily in a duel format, a fencer duels with another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Innvendig forgiftning er kanskje ikke umiddelbart tydelig. Symptomer, for eksempel oppkast er generelt ikke tilstrekkelig for at en umiddelbar diagnose kan gjøres. Den beste indikasjonen på innvendig forgiftning kan være at man finner åpne medisinbeholdere eller giftige husholdningsartikler på stedet. For førstehjelpveiledning spesielt for den aktuelle giften, se merkelappen.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately obvious. Symptoms, such as vomiting are generally not sufficient for an immediate diagnosis to be made. The best indication of internal poisoning can be finding open medicine containers or toxic household items at the scene. For first aid guidelines specifically for the relevant poison, see the label.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Du må sørge for å få oversikt over skadestedet før du tar hånd om den som har kommet til skade, dette er for din egen sikkerhet. Du er nødt til å legge merke til fornærmedes stilling etter hvert som du nærmer deg ham eller henne og eventuelle automatiske røde flagg. Hvis du blir skadet mens du prøver å hjelpe, kan det bidra til å gjøre alt mye verre.
mt: You must ensure that you have a good overview of the scene before you attend to the injured person, this is for your own safety. You must note the injured person's position as you approach them and any automatic red flags. If you are injured while trying to help, it may make things much worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Det er en del sosiale og politiske effekter som benyttelse av det metriske systemet, et bytte fra absolutisme til republikanisme, nasjonalisme og tro på at nasjonen styres av innbyggerne i stedet for bare én hersker. Også etter revolusjonen var det åpent for alle mannlige søkere som lot de mest ambisiøse og fremgangsrike til å lykkes. Det samme gjaldt forsvaret, fordi i stedet for militære rangordninger som baserer seg på klasse, baserte de seg nå på kaliber. Den franske revolusjonen var motivasjon for andre undertrykkede mennesker i arbeiderklasse i andre nasjoner til også å sette i gang sine egne revolusjoner.
mt: There are a number of social and political effects of the use of the metric system, a switch from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and belief that the nation is governed by its inhabitants instead of just one ruler. Also after the revolution, it was open to all male seekers who let the most ambitious and successful to succeed. The same went for the defense, because instead of military rankings based on class, they now based themselves on caliber. The French Revolution was motivation for other oppressed people in the working class of other nations to also start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Alle er med i samfunnet og benytter seg av transportsystemer. De fleste er misfornøyd med transportsystemer. I utviklede land kan man sjelden høre klager på kvaliteten på vann eller om broer som faller ned. Hvorfor frembringer systemer for transportering slik misnøye, hvorfor mislykkes de på daglig basis? Er transportingeniører inkompetente? Eller er det noe mer fundamentalt på gang?
mt: Everyone is part of the society and uses transportation systems. Most are dissatisfied with transportation systems. In developed countries, one rarely hears complaints about the quality of water or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems produce such dissatisfaction, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more fundamental at work?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Trafikkflyt er studien av individuelle sjåfører og kjøretøys bevegelser mellom to punkter og samspillet dem imellom. Dessverre er det komplisert å skulle studere trafikkflyt, siden det er umulig å forutsi atferden til sjåførene med hundre prosent sikkerhet. Sjåfører pleier heldigvis å oppføre seg med noenlunde konsistens slik at trafikkflyten holder seg ganske konsistent og med mulighet til å beregnes matematisk med en rimelig grad av sikkerhet. For å vise flyten i trafikken bedre, har det blitt etablert relasjoner mellom tre viktige egenskaper: (1) flyt, (2) tetthet, og (3) fart. Disse relasjonene hjelper i forbindelse med planlegging, design og drift av kjørebaneanlegg.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of individual drivers and vehicles movements between two points and their interactions. Unfortunately, it is impossible to predict the behavior of drivers with 100% certainty. Drivers usually behave with some consistency so that the traffic flow remains fairly consistent and can be calculated mathematically with a reasonable degree of certainty. To better show the flow of traffic, relationships have been established between three important characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in conjunction with planning, design, and operation of roadways.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Hershey og Chase-eksperimentet var et av de fremste forslagene som påsto at DNA kunne være et genetisk materiale. Hershey og Chase benyttet phager, eller med andre ord virus, for å implantere sitt eget DNA inn i en bakterie. De foretok 2 forsøk på å merke enten DNA-et i fagen med radioaktivt fosfor eller proteinet av fagen med radioaktivt svovel.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading proposals that claimed DNA could be a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or in other words viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They conducted 2 experiments to mark either the DNA in the phages with radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phages with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutasjoner kan ha en rekke ulike virkninger avhengig av mutasjonstype, betydningen av det genetiske materialet som påvirkes og om cellene som påvirkes er bakterieklinale celler. Det er kun mutasjoner i bakterieceller som kan bli overført til barn, mens andre mutasjoner kan føre til celledød eller kreft.
mt: Mutations can have a range of effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the genetic material affected, and whether the cells affected are bacterial cells. Only mutations in bacterial cells can be passed on to children, while other mutations can lead to cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Sannsynligvis ble geiter først ble temmet for ca. 10 000 år siden i Zagros-fjellene i Iran. Det begynte med at gamle kulturer og stammer beholdte dem for lett tilgang til melk, hår, kjøtt og skinn. Innenlandske geiter ble generelt holdt i flokker som spaserte på åser eller andre steder for beite, som regel ivaretatt av geitegjetere som ofte var barn eller ungdom, i likhet med den mer velkjente gjeteren. Disse metodene for herding benyttes fremdeles i dag.
mt: It is likely that goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. It began with ancient cultures and tribes keeping them for easy access to milk, hair, meat and skin. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that roamed hills or other places for grazing, usually attended by goat herders who were often children or youth, much like the more well-known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf er en sport der deltakerne bruker køller for å få ballene ned i hull. Atten hull spilles på en vanlig runde, og spillere starter som oftest på det første hullet på banen og avslutter på det attende. Spilleren som fullfører banen med færrest slag, eller svinger golfkøllen færrest ganger, vinner. Sporten blir spilt på gress, og gresset rundt hullet kuttes kortere og blir kalt green.
mt: Golf is a sport where players use clubs to get balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played in a round, and players usually start on the first hole on the course and finish on the eighteenth. The player who completes the course with the fewest strokes, or swings the golf club the fewest times, wins. The sport is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and is called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Hovedmålet med vitenskapen er å finne ut hvordan verden fungerer gjennom en vitenskapelig metode. Det meste vitenskapelig forskning blir faktisk styrt av denne metoden. Eksperimentering er dog ikke alene der, og et eksperiment er en test som brukes i å eliminere en eller flere av de potensielle hypotesene ved å stille spørsmål. Observasjoner bidrar også til å lede vitenskapelig forskning i riktig retning.
mt: The main goal of science is to find out how the world works through a scientific method. Most scientific research is actually guided by this method. Experimenting is not alone there, and an experiment is a test used to eliminate one or more of the potential hypotheses by posing questions. Observations also contribute to guide scientific research in the right direction.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornadoer treffer bare et lite sted sammenlignet med andre kraftige stormer, men de kan i tillegg ødelegge alt de kommer over. Tornadoer river opp trær, river paneler fra bygninger, og slenger biler opp i skyene. De mest voldelige tornadoene varer i mer enn tre timer. Disse monsterstormene har vinder opp mot 480 km/t (133 m/s; 300 amerikanske mil i timen).
mt: Tornadoes only hit a small area compared to other powerful storms, but they can also destroy everything they come over. Tornadoes rip up trees, rip siding from buildings, and sling cars up into the clouds. The most violent tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have wind speeds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 American miles per hour).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Mennesker har laget og benyttet forstørrelseslinser gjennom flere tusen år. De første ekte teleskopene ble skapt i Europa sent på 1500-tallet. Disse teleskopene kombinerte to objektiver for å vise fjerne objekter som om de var både nærmere og større.
mt: People have made and used magnifying glasses for thousands of years. The first real telescopes were created in Europe in the late 1500s. These telescopes combined two lenses to show distant objects as if they were both closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammad var veldig interessert i ting som går utover det dødelige livet. Han brukte ofte en hule som ble kjent som «Hira» på fjellet «Noor» (lys), hvor han dro for å tenke. selve hulen, som er oppbevart gjennom årene, gir en svært levende framstilling av Muhammads spirituelle tilbøyelighet. På en fjelltopp nord for Mekka, ligger hulen seg fullstendig isolert fra resten av planeten. Den er faktisk ikke lett å finne i det hele tatt, selv om man vet at den finnes. Med en gang man er inne i grotten er man fullstendig isolert. Det er ikke noe annet å se enn den klare, vakre himmelen over og de mange omkringliggende fjellene. Veldig lite av denne verden kan ses eller høres fra innsiden av grotten.
mt: Muhammad was very interested in things that go beyond the mortal life. He often used a cave that was known as "Hira" on the mountain "Noor" (light), where he went to think. The actual cave, which has been preserved over the years, gives a very vivid portrayal of Muhammad's spiritual inclination. On a mountain top north of Mecca, the cave sits completely isolated from the rest of the planet. It is actually not easy to find at all, even though you know it exists. As soon as you are inside the cave, you are completely isolated. There is nothing else to see but the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Vognbaner i England ble laget så tidlig som 1500-tallet. Selv om vognveiene bare besto av parallelle treplanker, lot de hester trekke seg for å oppnå større hastigheter og trekke mer last enn på de litt mer røffe veiene fra den tiden. For å holde sporene på plass ble krysskinnen innført ganske tidlig. Litt etter litt ble det imidlertid innsett at sporene var mer effektive om det var en stripe med jern på toppen. Dette ble en vanlig praksis, men strykejernet skapte mer slitasje på trehjulene i vognene. Etter hvert ble trehjulene byttet ut med jernhjul. I 1767 ble de første fulljernskinnene innført.
mt: Wagonways in England were built as early as the 1500s. Although wagonways only consisted of parallel wooden sleepers, horses were able to pull themselves to achieve greater speeds and pull more weight than on the slightly rougher roads of the time. To keep the rails in place, the cross-sleeper was introduced quite early. However, it was soon realized that the rails were more effective if there was a strip of iron on top. This became a common practice, but the iron strip caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced with iron wheels. In 1767, the first full iron rails were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
