src: Romantisme hadde et større element av kulturell determinisme, trukket ut fra skribenter som Goethe, Fichte og Schlegel. Det som preget romantikken var at landskapet formet enkeltpersoner og at det over tid oppstod geografiske vaner og kulturer, og at disse da de harmonerte med posisjonen i samfunnet, var bedre enn tilfeldig pålagte lover.
mt: Romanticism had a greater element of cultural determinism, drawn out from writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. What characterized romanticism was that the landscape shaped individuals and that over time geographical habits and cultures arose, and that these, when they harmonized with the position in society, were better than arbitrary laws.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Mughal-imperiet blandet seg ikke inn i samfunnskultur og tradisjoner i det meste av sin eksistens, men heller balanserte og pasifiserte dem gjennom nye administrative praksiser og mangfoldige og inkluderende styrende eliter, som førte til mer systematiske, sentraliserte og uniformerte regler. De fleste tolkninger av teknologisk determinisme deler to generelle oppfatninger: At utviklingen av teknologien selv følger en bane som er hinsides kulturell eller politisk innflytelse, og at teknologien i tillegg har «effekter» på samfunn som er iboende, heller enn sosialt betinget. En kan for eksempel si at veiutviklingen kommer på grunn av bilen. Et landsomfattende veinettverk er derimot ikke økonomisk levedyktig dersom det kun brukes av en håndfull biler, så nye metoder for produksjon er utviklet for å forminske kostnader ved bileierforhold. Massebileiereierskap skaper og flere forekomster av ulykker på veier, som har ført til at det blir funnet opp nye metoder i helsesektoren for å reparere skadde kropper.
mt: The Mughal Empire did not interfere in social culture and traditions in most of its existence, but rather balanced and pacified them through new administrative practices and diverse and inclusive governing elites, which led to more systematic, centralized and uniform rules. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general assumptions: That the development of technology itself follows a path that is beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in addition has "effects" on society that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. One can for example say that road development comes from the car. A nationwide road network is however not economically viable if it is only used by a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce costs of car ownership. Mass car ownership creates and more occurrences of accidents on roads, which has led to the invention of new methods in the health sector to repair damaged bodies.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: «Oppstrøk»-symbolet ligner på en V og «nedstrøk»-symbolet ligner på en stift eller en firkant uten bunn. Opp betyr at du bør starte på spissen og skyve buen, og ned betyr at du bør starte på frosken (som er der hånden din holder baugen) og skyve baugen. Et oppstrøk får vanligvis frem en mykere lyd, mens et nedstrøk er sterkere og mer bestemt. Du kan godt ta i bruk en blyant og lage dine egne merker, men ikke glem at de trykte bowing-merkene er der for en musikalsk grunn, så de bør som regel tas hensyn til.
mt: The "up" symbol looks like a V and the "down" symbol looks like a pen or a square without a bottom. Up means you should start at the tip and slide the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand holds the bow) and slide the bow. An upbow usually produces a softer sound, while a downbow is stronger and more definite. You can use a pencil and make your own marks, but don't forget that the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be taken into account.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Til forskjell fra andre primater, bruker ikke hominider lenger hendene til å bevege seg, bære vekt eller svinge seg mellom trærne. Sjimpansers hender og føtter ligner i størrelse og lengde, og reflekterer deres henders bruk av å bære tungt i knokevandring. Mennesker har kortere hånd enn fot, med rettere falanger. Fossile håndknokler som er 2–3 millioner år gamle avdekker denne utskiftningen i håndspesialisering fra bevegelse til manipulasjon.
mt: Unlike other primates, humans no longer use their hands to move, carry weight, or swing through trees. Chimpanzee hands and feet are similar in size and length, and reflect their hands' use of carrying weight in knuckle-walking. Humans have shorter hand than foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand knuckles that are 2–3 million years old reveal this shift in hand specialization from movement to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: I følge moderne forskning er det to typer genetisk variasjon: skjult og uttrykt. Mutasjon tilfører en ny genvariasjon og utvalget fjerner den fra utvalget av uttrykt variasjon. Segregasjon og rekombinasjon bytter frem og tilbake mellom de to bassengene med hver generasjon.
mt: According to modern research, there are two types of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds a new genetic variation and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination switch back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Det er vanskelig for en primat med et fordøyelsessystem lignende det mennesker har å få tilstrekkelig med aminosyrer fra de tilgjengelige planteressursene ute på savannen. Dessuten har det store konsekvenser å ikke gjøre det: vekstdepresjon, underernæring og til syvende og sist død. Proteinene som er i blader og belgfrukter ville vært de mest tilgjengelige planteressursene, men disse er vanskelige for primater som oss til å kunne fordøye uten å koke dem først. Animalske matvarer (maur, termitter, egg) er i kontrast ikke bare lett fordøyelig, men de gir også proteiner i høy kvantitet som inneholder alle de essensielle aminosyrene. Vi bør ikke bli forbauset dersom våre egne forfedre løste sitt «proteinproblem» med ganske helt lik metode som sjimpansene på savannen benytter i dag.
mt: It is difficult for a primate with a digestive system similar to ours to get enough amino acids from the available plant resources out on the savanna. Moreover, not doing so has large consequences: growth depression, undernutrition and ultimately death. The proteins that are in leaves and pods would be the most available plant resources, but these are difficult for primates like us to be able to digest without first cooking them. Animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) are in contrast not only easily digestible, but they also provide proteins in high quantities that contain all the essential amino acids. We should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" with a method that is quite similar to the one chimpanzees on the savanna use today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Delkulturer fører sammen likesinnede personer som føler seg utelatt fra de sosiale standardene og lar dem utvikle en identitetsfølelse. Subkulturer kan være spesielle på grunn av deres medlemmers alder, etnisitet, klasse, område og/eller kjønn. De kvalitetene som spesifiserer en subkultur inkluderer lingvistisk, estetisk, religiøs, politisk, seksuell, geografisk eller en kombinasjon av flere faktorer. Medlemmer av en subkultur markerer ofte sitt medlemskap ved en særpreget og symbolsk bruk av stil, som inkluderer moter, manérer og slang.
mt: Subcultures bring together like-minded people who feel excluded from the social standards and allow them to develop an identity feeling. Subcultures can be special because of their members' age, ethnicity, class, area and/or gender. The qualities that specify a subculture include linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical or a combination of several factors. Members of a subculture often mark their membership by a distinctive and symbolic use of style, including fashion, manners and slang.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Barn utvikler ganske tidlig en bevissthet rundt rase og rasemessige fordommer, og disse rasemessige fordommene påvirker adferd. Barn som anser seg selv som en minoritet og som stereotypisk gjør det dårlig på skolen, vil for eksempel ha en tendens til å ikke gjøre det bra på skolen når de blir gjort oppmerksomme på stereotypen som assosieres med rasen deres.
mt: Children develop a consciousness of race and racial prejudice at a very early age, and these racial prejudices affect behavior. Children who consider themselves a minority and who stereotypically do poorly in school, for example, will tend not to do well in school when made aware of the stereotype associated with their race.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "En av de mest vanlige metodene som blir benyttet for å illustrere hvor betydningsfullt det er med sosialisering, er å ta utgangspunkt i de få uheldige sakene hos barn som gjennom forsømmelse, uhell eller forsettlig misbruk, ikke ble tilstrekkelig sosialisert av voksne under oppveksten. Slike barn blir kalt for ""villunger"". Noen ville barn har blitt holdt i fangenskap av mennesker(vanligvis sine egne foreldre), i noen tilfeller skyldtes dette foreldrenes avvisning av et barns alvorlige intellektuelle eller fysiske svekkelser. Det er mulig at barn som er vill kan ha gjennomgått seriøs barnemishandling eller traumer før de ble forlatt eller klarte å flykte. Andre skal angivelig ha blitt oppfostret av dyr; noen sies å ha levd i naturen på egenhånd. Når et vilt barn er fullstendig oppdratt av dyr, utvikler det atferd (innenfor fysiske begrensninger) som er nesten identisk med det oppfostrende dyret, som for eksempel frykt for eller likegyldighet overfor mennesker."
mt: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate how important socialization is, is to take the few unfortunate cases of children who, through neglect, accident or deliberate abuse, were not sufficiently socialized by adults during childhood. Such children are called ""feral"". Some feral children have been kept in captivity by humans (usually their own parents), in some cases this was due to their parents' rejection of a child's serious intellectual or physical weaknesses. It is possible that children who are feral have undergone serious child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or able to escape. Others are said to have been raised by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When a feral child is completely raised by animals, it develops behavior (within physical limitations) that is almost identical to the nurturing animal, such as fear of or indifference towards humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Selvforsynt landbruk er landbruk for produksjon av nok mat til å akkurat oppfylle behovene for bonden og vedkommendes familie. Selvbergingsjordbruk er et enkelt, ofte økologisk, system som bruker lagrede frø som hører til området kombinert med vekstrotasjon eller andre teknikker for å maksimere avkastningen som er relativt enkle. Historisk sett var de fleste bøndene opptatt av selvbergingsjordbruk, noe som fortsatt er aktuelt i mange utviklingsland.
mt: Self-sufficient farming is farming for the production of just enough food to meet the needs of the farmer and his family. Self-sufficiency farming is a simple, often organic, system that uses stored seeds that belong to the area combined with crop rotation or other techniques to maximize yield that is relatively simple. Historically, most farmers were engaged in self-sufficiency farming, which is still relevant in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Selvforsynt landbruk er landbruk for produksjon av nok mat til å akkurat oppfylle behovene for bonden og vedkommendes familie. Selvbergingsjordbruk er et enkelt, ofte økologisk, system som bruker lagrede frø som hører til området kombinert med vekstrotasjon eller andre teknikker for å maksimere avkastningen som er relativt enkle. Historisk sett var de fleste bøndene opptatt av selvbergingsjordbruk, noe som fortsatt er aktuelt i mange utviklingsland.
mt: Self-sufficient farming is farming for the production of just enough food to meet the needs of the farmer and his family. Self-sufficiency farming is a simple, often organic, system that uses stored seeds that belong to the area combined with crop rotation or other techniques to maximize yield that is relatively simple. Historically, most farmers were engaged in self-sufficiency farming, which is still relevant in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Den vanligste typen turisme er den de fleste tenker på med reising: Rekreasjonsturisme. Dette er når folk reiser til et sted som skiller seg fra deres vanlige hverdag for å finne roen og ha det kjekt. De vanligste stedene som fritidsturister besøker er strender, fornøyelsesparker og campingplasser. Kulturhistorie er kjent som den typen turisme der målet med et besøk på et bestemt sted er å bli kjent med dets historie og kultur. Turister har mulighet til å dra til ulike landemerker i et land eller de kan rett og slett velge å holde seg på kun ett sted.
mt: The most common type of tourism is the one most people think of when traveling: recreational tourism. This is when people travel to a place that differs from their usual daily life to find peace and have fun. The most common places tourists visit are beaches, amusement parks and campgrounds. Cultural history is known as the type of tourism where the goal of a visit to a certain place is to get to know its history and culture. Tourists have the opportunity to travel to different landmarks in a country or they can simply choose to stay at just one place.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Individer som hadde vært med i mange tiår bidro til å verdsette våre kvaliteter og lidenskap, samtidig til oppriktig vurdering av vanskeligheter og til og med svikt. Vi fikk verdifull innsikt i fortiden og noen av personlighetene som påvirket organisasjonens kultur på godt og vondt da vi lyttet til enkeltpersoner som delte sine egne historier og historiene til familien og organisasjonen. Selv om forståelse av en persons historie ikke nødvendigvis innebærer forståelse av personens kultur, så kan det i hvert fall bidra til at mennesker får en følelse av hvor de faller innenfor organisasjonens historie. Mens man vurderer suksesser og blir oppmerksom på feil, oppdager alle de mer dyp verdiene, meningen og drivkreftene i organisasjonen. I denne forekomsten var det å tilbakekalle tidligere forekomster av gründeres atferd og resulterende suksesser virkningsfullt for at folk ble mer åpne for nye endringer og ny retning når det kom til den lokale kirken. Slike suksesshistorier reduserer frykten for endring, mens de skaper positiv påvirkning mot endring i fremtiden.
mt: Individuals who had been involved for many years contributed to valuing our qualities and passion, at the same time as they were open to honest evaluation of difficulties and even failure. We gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities that influenced the organization's culture for good and bad as we listened to individuals who shared their own stories and the stories of their family and organization. While understanding a person's history does not necessarily mean understanding the person's culture, it can at least contribute to people having a sense of where they fit within the organization's history. While evaluating successes and being mindful of mistakes, everyone discovers the deeper values, meaning and driving forces in the organization. In this instance, it was effective to recall earlier instances of the founders' behavior and resulting successes to make people more open to new changes and new direction when it came to the local church. Such success stories reduce the fear of change, while they create positive influence towards change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Med den postmoderne tilnærming til læring tilbys frihet fra absoluttene. Det finnes ikke bare én god måte å lære på. Faktisk finnes det ikke én god ting å lære. Læring finner sted i opplevelsen mellom studenten og den kunnskapen som presenteres. Vår nåværende erfaring med alle gjør-det-selv, læringsbaserte tv-serier som presenterer informasjon, illustrerer dette punktet. Det er mange av oss som bare ender opp med å se på en tv-serie som forteller om en prosess eller opplevelse som vi aldri kommer til å være med på selv og gir oss kunnskap som vi aldri kommer til å ta i bruk. Vi ville aldri ha overhalt en bil, bygd en fontene i hagen vår, reist til Peru for å studere gamle ruiner, eller pusset opp naboens hus.
mt: With the postmodern approach to learning, freedom from absolutes is offered. There is not just one good way to learn. In fact, there is not just one good thing to learn. Learning takes place in the experience between the student and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all do-it-yourself, learning-based TV shows that present information illustrates this point. There are many of us who just end up watching a TV show that tells about a process or experience that we will never be a part of ourselves and gives us knowledge that we will never use. We would never have owned a car, built a fountain in our yard, traveled to Peru to study ancient ruins, or fixed up our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Søvnavbrudd er prosessen med bevisst oppvåkning under den normale søvnperioden mens man faller i søvn igjen kort tid senere (10-60 minutter). Dette kan man lett få til ved å bruke en ganske stille vekkerklokke som bringer deg til bevissthet uten helt å vekke deg. Hvis du opplever at du slår av alarmen i søvne, kan du plasseres den på den andre siden av rommet slik at du blir tvunget til å gå ut av sengen for å skru den av. Andre alternativer basert på biorytme innebærer å ha drukket masse væske (særlig vann eller te, et kjent vanndrivende middel) før man sover, og dette fører til at man er nødt til å stå opp for å urinere.
mt: Sleep disruption is the process of conscious awakening during the normal sleep period while falling asleep again shortly afterwards (10-60 minutes). This can be easily achieved by using a very quiet alarm clock that brings you to consciousness without completely waking you up. If you find yourself turning off the alarm in your sleep, you can place it on the other side of the room so that you are forced to get out of bed to turn it off. Other alternatives based on the biological clock involve having drunk a lot of liquid (especially water or tea, a well-known diuretic) before going to bed, and this forces you to get up to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Noen mener at det å oppleve mange framtidsrettede, klare drømmer ofte på en kunstig indusert måte, kan være veldig slitsomt. Hovedgrunnen til dette fenomenet er resultatet av at de klare drømmene øker tiden mellom REM-tilstander. Med mindre REM-søvn per natt, blir tilstanden der du opplever faktisk søvn og kroppen tar seg igjen, så sjelden at det blir et problem. Dette er like slitsomt som om du skulle våkne hvert tjuende eller trettiende minutt og se på TV. Effekten avhenger av hvor ofte hjernen din forsøker å tydeliggjøre drømmer per natt.
mt: Some believe that experiencing many future-oriented, clear dreams often in an artificially induced manner can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the clear dreams increasing the time between REM states. With less REM sleep per night, the state where you actually sleep and the body recovers, is so seldom that it becomes a problem. This is as exhausting as waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching TV. The effect depends on how often your brain tries to clarify dreams per night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Virtuelle lag blir holdt til de samme standardene for fortreffelighet som konvensjonelle lag, men det finnes subtile forskjeller. Virtuelle lagmedlemmer fungerer ofte som punkt for kontakt for sin umiddelbare fysiske gruppe. De har som regel mer selvstyrerett enn vanlige lagmedlemmer, ettersom lagene deres kan finne på å møtes i henhold til mange ulike tidssoner, noe som den lokale ledelsen muligens ikke alltid har forståelse for. Et «usynlig team» som er tilstedeværende (Larson og LaFasto, 1989, p 109) er også et unikt element i et virtuelt team. Den «usynlige gruppen» er ledelsesgruppen som hver av medlemmene rapporterer til. Den usynlige gruppen setter standarden for hvert enkelt medlem.
mt: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often serve as contact points for their immediate physical group. They usually have more autonomy than regular team members, since their teams may meet according to many different time zones, which the local leadership may not always understand. A "phantom team" that is present (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p 109) is also a unique element in a virtual team. The "phantom group" is the leadership group that each member reports to. The phantom group sets the standard for each individual member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Innholdsteorier fokuserer på å finne det som motiverer eller appellerer til folk. Disse teoriene tyder på at folk har bestemte behov og/eller ønsker som har blitt internalisert etter hvert som de blir mer modne og nærmer seg voksenalder. Disse teoriene ser på hva det er med enkelte personer som gjør at de vil ha tingene de vil ha og hvilke ting i deres miljø som får dem til å gjøre eller ikke gjøre visse ting. To populære innholdsteorier er Maslows behovshierarki og Hertzbergs tofaktorteori.
mt: Content theories focus on finding what motivates or appeals to people. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or wants that have been internalized as they mature and approach adulthood. These theories look at what it is with certain individuals that makes them want the things they want and what in their environment gets them to do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's hierarchy of needs and Herzberg's two-factor theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Tredelingsreglene er mye misbrukt og ofte latterliggjort, men er en enkel retningslinje som skaper dynamikk samtidig som man har et mål for orden i et bilde. Den fastslår at den mest effektive plasseringen av hovedmotivet er ved skjæringspunktet mellom linjer som deler bildet inn i tredeler horisontalt og vertikalt (se eksempel).
mt: 3/4 rule is often misused and sometimes ridiculed, but is a simple guideline that creates dynamics while having a goal for order in an image. It states that the most effective placement of the main subject is at the intersection of lines that divide the image into thirds horizontally and vertically (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: F.eks. er 35 mm fortsatt det mest vanlige formatet for stillbildefotografering i verden, som var den dominerende filmstørrelsen ved slutten av den analoge filmepoken. Det produseres fortsatt i dag, men enda viktigere er det at digitalkameraets bildesensorformater har arvet størrelsesforholdet til kameraet. Det kan være litt forvirrende, men 35mm-formatet er faktisk 36 mm i bredden og 24 mm i høyden. Aspektet forhold til dette formatet (divisjon med tolv for å innhente det enkleste heltallforholdet), er derfor sagt til å være 3:2. Mange vanlige formater (for eksempel APS-familie formater) er lik, eller tilnærmet lik dette aspektets forholdstall.
mt: 35mm is still the most common format for still photography in the world, which was the dominant film size at the end of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly, the digital camera's image sensor format has inherited the size ratio to the camera. It can be a little confusing, but the 35mm format is actually 36mm wide and 24mm high. The aspect ratio to this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole number ratio), is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (such as APS family formats) are similar, or approximately similar to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Ulempen med zoomobjektiv er at sammensetningen og antallet linseelementer som trengs for å oppnå en variasjon i brennvidde er mye større enn for fastobjektiv. Dette blir stadig et mindre problem siden linseprodusenter nå har høyere standard i produksjonen av linser. Dette har muliggjort at zoomobjektiver har kunnet produsere bilder av en kvalitet som er sammenlignbar med den man oppnår med objektiver med fast fokuslengde. En annen ulempe med zoomobjektiv er at maksimal blenderåpning (hastigheten) for linsen som regel er mindre. Dette gjør billige zoom-linser vanskelig å bruke i dårlige lysforhold uten blits.
mt: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the combination and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for fixed-focus lenses. This is becoming less of a problem since lens manufacturers now have higher standards in lens production. This has enabled zoom lenses to produce images of a quality comparable to that achieved with fixed-focus lenses. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually less. This makes cheap zoom lenses difficult to use in poor light conditions without a flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Mystikk er jakten på tilhørigheten til, eller en klar bevissthet om den ytterste virkelighet, guddommelighet, spirituell sannhet eller Gud. Den troende er på jakt etter intuisjon, eller innsikt i guddommelig sannhet / guddom eller guddommer, eller en direkte opplevelse. Trostilhengere lever på en bestemt måte, eller følger en praksis som skal drive frem de opplevelsene. Man kan skille mystikk fra andre former for religiøs tro og tilbedelse ved at det legger mer vekt på den direkte personlige opplevelsen av en unik bevissthetstilstand, spesielt de med en fredelig, innsiktsfull, lykkelig eller til og med ekstatisk karakter.
mt: Mystery is the quest for belonging to, or a clear awareness of the ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth or God. The believer is in search of intuition, or insight into divine truth / divinity or divinities, or a direct experience. Devotees live in a certain way, or follow a practice that is supposed to bring about the experiences. One can distinguish mystery from other forms of religious belief and worship by the fact that it places more emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, especially those with a peaceful, insightful, happy or even ecstatic character.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Lenge antok man på 1800- og 1900-tallet at de første innbyggerne i New Zealand var maori-folket, som jaktet på kjempefugler som het moaer. Teorien la da grunnlaget for teorien om at Maori-folket migrerte fra Polynesia på en stor flåte og tok New Zealand fra Moriori, og deretter etablerte et samfunn for landbruk. Derimot er det nye bevis som peker mot at moriori var en gruppe med maorier fra fastlandet som migrerte fra New Zealand til Chathamøyene, der de skapte sin egen spesielle, fredelige kultur. Det var også en annen stamme på Chathamøyene. Disse var Maori som var utvandret fra New Zealand. De kalte seg selv Morioriene. Det var noen få sammenstøt, og til slutt ble Morioriene utslettet.
mt: 1800s and 1900s, it was assumed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory was based on the theory that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia on a large fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, and then established a farming community. However, new evidence points to the Moriori being a group of Maori from the mainland who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, where they created their own special, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham Islands. These were Maori who had emigrated from New Zealand. They called themselves Moriori. There were a few clashes, and eventually the Moriori were exterminated.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pureland origami er origami som har den begrensningen at man bare kan gjøre én fold om gangen, mens mer komplekse folder som omvendte folder ikke er tillatt, og alle folder har likefremme plasseringer. For å hjelpe uerfarne foldere eller de med begrensede motoriske ferdigheter ble den utviklet på 1970-tallet av John Smith.
mt: Pureland origami is origami that has the restriction that one can only make one fold at a time, while more complex folds such as inverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have equal placements. To help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills it was developed in the 1970s by John Smith.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Sivilisasjonen i Indus-dalen var en bronsealdersivilisasjon på det nordvestlige indiske subkontinentet som omfattet det meste av det moderne Pakistan og noen regioner i nordvestlige India og nordøstlige Afghanistan. Induselven har fått navnet sitt fra den blomstrende sivilisasjonen i områdene rundt elven. Selv om enkelte forskere spekulerer i noen lærde tror at siden sivilisasjonen også eksisterte i det uttørkede elveleiet til Sarasvati-elva, bør det være riktig å kalle den for Indus-Sarasvati-sivilisasjonen, selv om noen kaller den for Harappan-sivilisasjonen etter Harappa, det første av stedene som skulle graves ut i 1920-årene.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in the northwestern Indian subcontinent, dating from the 33rd century BCE. It is also known as the Harappan Civilization, after the type site at Harappa, the first of its sites to be discovered and excavated. The Indus Valley Civilization is also known as the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, after the Indus and Sarasvati rivers, which are believed to have been the main rivers of the civilization. Some scholars prefer to call it the Harappan Civilization, after the type site at Harappa, the first of its sites to be discovered and excavated.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Grådighet og egoisme vil alltid være en del av oss, og det er samarbeidets natur at med en gang flertallet har en fordel, vil man alltid få mer igjen på kort sikt dersom man handler egoistisk. Forhåpentligvis ser de fleste etter hvert at det beste langsiktige alternativet er å jobbe sammen med de andre.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be part of us, and it is the nature of cooperation that as soon as the majority has an advantage, one will always get more in the short term if one acts selfishly. Hopefully, most people eventually see that the best long-term alternative is to work together with the others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Det filippinske folket måtte selv betale for kostnaden av krigens amerikansk imperialisme, i erobringen av Filippinene. De måtte skatte med tvang til det amerikanske koloniregimet for å dekke store deler av kostnadene, og renten for obligasjoner foregikk i navnet på Filippinske myndigheter via bankhusene i Wall Street. Superinntektene hentet fra utnyttelsen av det filippinske folket var en grunnleggende gevinst av USAs imperialisme.
mt: The Filipino people had to pay for the cost of American imperialism's war of conquest, the Philippine-American War. They had to tax themselves by force to the American colonial regime to cover much of the cost, and the interest on bonds went in the name of Philippine authorities through the banks of Wall Street. The superprofits gained from the exploitation of the Filipino people were a fundamental gain of US imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: For å forstå Tempelridderne må man forstå omstendigheten som førte til opprettelsen av ordren. Alderen der hendelsene fant sted omtales vanligvis som Høymiddelalderen i perioden europeisk historie som er det 11., 12., og 13. århundret (AD 1000-1300). Høymiddelalderen kom etter tidlig middelalder og etterfulgt av den sene middelalderen, som etter konvensjon ender rundt 1500.
mt: To understand the Knights Templar, one must understand the circumstances that led to the order's creation. The age in which the events took place is usually referred to as the High Middle Ages in the period of European history that is the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000-1300). The High Middle Ages came after the early Middle Ages and was followed by the late Middle Ages, which conventionally ends around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Den militaristiske naturen av det romerske imperiet har vært til stor hjelp i den medisinske utviklingen. Keiser Augustus rekrutterte leger og dannet til og med det første romerske legekorpset for bruk etter kamper. Kirurger hadde kunnskap om ulike sedativer inkludert morfin utvunnet av valmuefrø og skopolamin fra herbane frø. De ble kompetente på amputasjon for å redde pasienter fra koldbrann så vel som turniké og arterielle klemmer for å stoppe blødning. Over flere århundrer førte det romerske imperiet til stor fremgang i det medisinske feltet og skapte mye av den kunnskapen vi vet om i vår tid.
mt: The military nature of the Roman Empire has been of great help in medical development. Emperor Augustus recruited doctors and even formed the first Roman medical corps for use after battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine extracted from poppy seeds and scopolamine from henbane seeds. They were competent in amputation to save patients from frostbite as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stop bleeding. Over several centuries, the Roman Empire led to great progress in the medical field and created much of the knowledge we know today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Synet, eller evnen til å se, avhenger av visuelle systemsanseorganer eller øyne. Det finnes mange ulike konstruksjoner av øyne og alt avhenger av kompleksiteten til kravene til organismen. De ulike konstruksjonene har ulike muligheter, er følsomme for ulike bølgelengder og har forskjellig grad av skarphet, samt de krever annen behandling for å gi mening av inntastingen og ulike tall for å arbeide optimalt.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on visual sense organs or eyes. There are many different eye constructions and all depends on the complexity of the organism's requirements. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wavelengths and have different degrees of sharpness, as well as different treatment is required to give meaning to the input and different numbers to work optimally.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhisme er en religion fra det indiske subkontinentet. Det oppsto i Punjab-regionen i løpet av det 15. århundre fra en sektariansk inndeling innenfor hindutradisjonen. Sikher mener at deres tro er separat fra Hinduismen, men de erkjenner sine hinduistiske røtter og tradisjoner. Sikher kaller religionen sin for Gurmat, som på punjabi står for «guruens vei». Guruen er et fundamentalt aspekt gjennom alle religioner fra India, men i sikhismen har den en betydning som former selve kjernen i sikh-troen. Religionen ble grunnlagt på det 15. århundre av Guru Nanak (1469 til 1539). Deretter fulgte en arverekkefølge på 9 guruer.
mt: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian subcontinent. It arose in the Punjab region in the 15th century from a sectarian division within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs believe that their faith is separate from Hinduism, but they recognize their Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which in Punjabi means "the way of the guru." The guru is a fundamental aspect throughout all religions from India, but in Sikhism it has a meaning that forms the very core of Sikh belief. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469 to 1539). Thereafter followed a succession of nine gurus.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

Sikher mener at deres tro er separat fra Hinduismen, men de erkjenner sine hinduistiske røtter og tradisjoner. Sikher kaller religionen sin for Gurmat, som på punjabi står for «guruens vei». Guruen er et fundamentalt aspekt gjennom alle religioner fra India, men i sikhismen har den en betydning som former selve kjernen i sikh-troen. Religionen ble grunnlagt på det 15. århundre av Guru Nanak (1469 til 1539). Deretter fulgte en arverekkefølge på 9 guruer.
mt: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian subcontinent. It arose in the Punjab region in the 15th century from a sectarian division within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs believe that their faith is separate from Hinduism, but they recognize their Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which in Punjabi means "the way of the guru." The guru is a fundamental aspect throughout all religions from India, but in Sikhism it has a meaning that forms the very core of Sikh belief. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469 to 1539). Thereafter followed a succession of nine gurus.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: ADD (Attention Deficit Disorder) «er et nevrologisk syndrom med den klassisk definerte triaden av symptomer som inkluderer impulsivitet, distraksjon og hyperaktivitet eller overflødig energi». Dette er ikke en lærevanske, men derimot en læreforstyrrelse som «påvirker 3–5% av alle barn og muligens så mange som 2 millioner amerikanske barn». Barn med ADD har problemer med å fokusere på saker som skolearbeid, men de kan konsentrere seg når de holder på med saker de koser seg med som å spille spill, se på yndlingstegnefilmene sine eller skrive setninger uten tegnsetting. Disse barna pleier ofte å havne i trøbbel fordi de «engasjerer seg i risikabel oppførsel, slåsskamper og utfordrer autoriteter» for å stimulere hjernen sin. Dette skjer fordi hjernen deres ikke kan stimuleres med vanlige metoder. ADD har stor påvirkning på forholdet til andre jevnaldrende ettersom de andre barna ikke forstår hvorfor de oppfører seg eller staver slik de gjør, eller hvorfor modenhetsnivået deres er forskjellig.
mt: ADD (Attention Deficit Disorder) is a neurologic syndrome with the classic defined triad of symptoms that includes impulsivity, distractibility and hyperactivity or excessive energy. This is not a learning disability, but rather a learning disorder that affects 3–5% of all children and possibly as many as 2 million American children. Children with ADD have problems focusing on schoolwork, but can concentrate when they are engaged in things they enjoy such as playing games, watching their favorite cartoons, or writing sentences without punctuation. These children often get into trouble because they "engage in risky behavior, fight and challenge authority" to stimulate their brains. This happens because their brains cannot be stimulated by normal methods. ADD has a large impact on peer relationships because other children do not understand why they behave or spell the way they do, or why their maturity level is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Selv om prosjektbasert undervisning gjør læring enklere og mer interessant, tar stillasbygging det til et nytt nivå. Scaffolding er ikke en læremetode, men snarere et hjelpemiddel som støtter enkeltpersoner som undergår en ny læringsopplevelse som for eksempel ved hjelp av et nytt dataprogram, eller begynner på et nytt prosjekt. Stillas kan både være virtuelle og fysiske. En lærer kan også med andre ord, være en form for stillas, men det er også den lille bindersmannen i Microsoft Office. Virtuelle støttefunksjoner er lagt inn i programvaren og er ment å stille spørsmål ved, tilskynde til, og forklare fremgangsmåter som kan ha vært å utfordrende for eleven å håndtere på egenhånd.
mt: While project-based learning makes learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding takes it to a new level. Scaffolding is not a teaching method, but rather a support tool that supports individuals undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program, or starting a new project. Scaffolds can both be virtual and physical. A teacher can also be a form of scaffolding, but it is also the little binder man in Microsoft Office. Virtual support functions are built into the software and are intended to ask questions about, encourage, and explain methods that may have been challenging for the student to handle on their own.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace er den 3. mest populære nettsiden i USA og har nå 54 millioner registrerte profiler. Disse nettsidene har fått svært mye oppmerksomhet, og da særlig i utdannelsesmiljøet. Det finnes flere positive aspekter ved disse nettsidene, som bl.a. omfatter å kunne enkelt konfigurere en klasseside som blogger, videoer, bilder og andre funksjoner. Denne siden kan enkelt gis tilgang til ved å tilby bare én nettadresse, noe som er enklere å huske og lett å skrive inn for studenter. som kan ha problemer med å bruke tastaturet eller med staving. Den kan endres til å gjøre det lettere å lese, med så mye eller lite farge som er nødvendig.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States and now has 54 million registered profiles. These websites have received a lot of attention, and especially in the educational environment. There are several positive aspects to these websites, including being able to easily configure a class page as a blog, videos, pictures and other functions. This page can easily be accessed by offering only one web address, which is easier to remember and easy to type in for students who may have problems using the keyboard or spelling. It can be changed to make it easier to read, with as much or little color as necessary.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: I juni 1956 ble Krutsjov sine løfter testet da opptøyer i Polen ble til en generell demonstrasjon mot kommunismen mens arbeidstakere demonstrerte mot mangel på mat og lønnskutt,. Til tross for at Krutsjov til slutt sendte inn stridsvogner for å gjenopprette orden, gav han etter for visse finansielle krav og godkjente utnevnelsen av den godt likte Wladyslaw Gomulka til ny statsminister.
mt: In June 1956, Khrushchev's promises were tested when riots in Poland turned into a general demonstration against communism while workers demonstrated against food shortages and wage cuts. Despite sending in tanks to restore order, he eventually gave in to some financial demands and approved the appointment of the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Tyskland var en felles fiende i andre verdenskrig, som forårsaket samarbeid mellom USSR og USA. Sammenstøtene mellom system, prosess og kultur førte til at landene falt ut mot slutten av krigen. To år etter slutten på krigen var de tidligere allierte nå blitt fiender, og den kalde krigen begynte. Det skulle vare de neste 40 årene og skulle virkelig bli utkjempet, av proxyhærer på slagmarker i Afghanistan, Cuba og mange andre steder i Afrika til Asia.
mt: Germany was a common enemy in World War II, which caused cooperation between USSR and USA. Conflicts between systems, processes and cultures led to the two countries falling out at the end of the war. Two years after the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies, and the Cold War began. It would last the next 40 years and would really be fought, by proxy armies on battlefields in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places in Africa to Asia.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Nervesystemet beholder homeostase med nerveimpulser som sendes rundt i kroppen for å holde blodstrømmen i gang uten forstyrrelser. Disse nerveimpulsene kan sendes så raskt gjennom hele kroppen, noe som gjør at kroppen holder seg trygg fra mulige farer.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis with nerve impulses sent around the body to keep the blood flowing without disruptions. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the entire body, which keeps the body safe from possible dangers.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Den eneste av de sju underverkene som fortsatt står i dag er den store pyramiden i Giza. Den store pyramiden er en av mange store pyramidestrukturer bygget for å hedre døde Farao. Giza-platået, eller «Giza nekropolis» i kongenes dalen i Egypt, omfatter mange pyramider (der den store pyramiden er størst), mange små graver, templer og den store Sphinxen. Den store pyramiden ble laget for å hylle farao Khufu, mens mange av de mindre pyramidene, gravene og templene ble laget for å hylle konene og familiemedlemmene til Khufu.
mt: The only one of the seven wonders that still stands is the Great Pyramid of Giza. The Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor the dead Pharaoh. The Giza plateau, or "Giza necropolis" in the valley of the kings in Egypt, includes many pyramids (where the Great Pyramid is the largest), many small graves, temples and the Great Sphinx. The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, while many of the smaller pyramids, graves and temples were built to honor the queens and family members of Khufu.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Tempelet Artemis på Efesus ble ødelagt 21. juli, 356 BCE i en mordbrann begått av Heltemarat. Ifølge historien var motivasjonen hans å få berømmelse til enhver pris. Efeserne kunngjorde opprørt at Heroinatus navn aldri skulle bli registrert. Etter hvert noterte den greske historikeren Strabo navnet slik vi vet om det i vår tid. Tempelet ble ødelagt den natten Alexander den store kom til verden. Som konge tilbød Alexander seg å betale for å gjenoppbygge tempelet, men tilbudet hans ble avslått. Tempelet ble senere bygd opp igjen i 323 f.Kr. etter at Alexander døde.
mt: 21 July, 356 BCE, the Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed in a murder fire committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was to gain fame at any cost. The Ephesians announced in outrage that Herostratus' name would never be recorded. Eventually, the Greek historian Strabo noted the name as we know it in our time. The temple was destroyed that night Alexander the Great was born. As king, Alexander offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was rejected. The temple was later rebuilt in 323 BCE after Alexander died.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Spasering var det første kjente transportmiddelet. Mennesker begynte å gå oppreist for 2 millioner år siden når Homo Erectus (som betyr oppreist mann) vokste frem. Deres forgjengere, Australopithecinerene, gikk vanligvis ikke oppreist. Sahelanthropus kan ha spasert med 2 ben så tidlig som for 7 millioner år siden, og det er oppdaget toveis spesialisering i fossiler ved Australopithecus fra 4,2–3,9 millioner år siden.
mt: 2 million years ago, when Homo Erectus (meaning upright man) appeared, people began to walk upright. Their predecessors, Australopithecines, usually did not walk upright. Sahelanthropus may have walked bipedally as early as 7 million years ago, and two-way specialization has been found in fossils of Australopithecus from 4.2–3.9 million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Å bruke skip til å frakte varer er uten tvil den mest effektive måten å flytte store mengder med mennesker og varer på tvers av hav. Jobben til marinene har tradisjonelt sett vært å sikre at landet ditt opprettholder evnen til å flytte sine folk og varer, samtidig som man blander seg inn i fiendens evne til å flytte sine folk og varer. Kampanjen i Nord-Atlanteren under andre verdenskrig er et av de viktigste ferske eksemplene på dette. Amerikanerne forsøkte å flytte menn og materialer over Atlanterhavet for å gi hjelp til Storbritannia. Den tyske marinen forsøkte samtidig å stoppe denne trafikken, for det meste med bruk av ubåter. Hadde de allierte sviktet, ville Tyskland trolig ha klart å erobre Storbritannia på samme måte som resten av Europa.
mt: It is without doubt that using ships to transport goods is the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across the sea. The job of the navy has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move its people and goods, while at the same time interfering with the enemy's ability to move its people and goods. The campaign in the North Atlantic during World War II is one of the freshest examples of this. The Americans were trying to move men and material across the Atlantic to help Britain. The German navy was trying to stop this traffic, mostly with submarines. Had the allies failed, Germany would likely have been able to conquer Britain in the same way as the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

The job of the navy has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move its people and goods, while at the same time interfering with the enemy's ability to move its people and goods. The campaign in the North Atlantic during World War II is one of the freshest examples of this. The Americans were trying to move men and material across the Atlantic to help Britain. The German navy was trying to stop this traffic, mostly with submarines. Had the allies failed, Germany would likely have been able to conquer Britain in the same way as the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Oppfinnelsen av eikerhjulet gjorde de Assyriske vognene lettere, raskere, og bedre egnet til å kunne kjøre bort fra soldater og andre trusler. Piler fra det dødelige armbrøstet kunne trenge gjennom rustningen til rivaliserende soldater. Assyrianerne introduserte det første kavaleriet ca. 1000 år f.Kr. En hær som kjemper på hesteryggen kalles for et kavaleri. Siden salen enda ikke var oppfunnet, måtte det assyriske kavaleriet kjempe barbak på hestene sine.
mt: The invention of the spoked wheel made the Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better suited to being able to drive away from soldiers and other threats. Arrows from the deadly bow could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. The Assyrians introduced the first cavalry around 1000 BC. An army that fights on horseback is called a cavalry. Since the salon was not yet invented, the Assyrian cavalry had to fight bareback on their horses.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Babylonerne bygget opp et primærtempel til hver gud og disse ble sett på som hjemmet til Gud. Mennesker tok med ofringer til gudene og prestene forsøkte å oppfylle gudenes behov med seremonier og festivaler. Hvert tempel hadde et åpent gårdsplass og et indre fristed som bare prestene kunne gå inn i. Noen ganger bygget de spesielle pyramideformede tårn, kalt ziggurater, som del av templene. Toppen av tårnet var et spesielt fristed laget for guden.
mt: The Babylonians built a primary temple to each god and these were seen as the home of God. People brought offerings to the gods and the priests tried to meet the needs of the gods with ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard and an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes they built special pyramid-shaped towers, called ziggurats, as part of the temples. The top of the tower was a special inner sanctuary made for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Ja! Kong Tutankhamon, som noen ganger blir omtalt som «Kong Tut» eller «Barnekongen», er i moderne tid en av de mest kjente egyptiske kongere fra det gamle Egypt. Interessant nok ble han ikke sett på som betydningsfull i oldtiden og ble ikke nevnt på de fleste eldre kongelister. Oppdagelsen av hans grav i 1922 gjorde ham imidlertid til kjendis. Mens mange av gravene hadde blitt ranet i fortiden, var dette gravkammeret igjen nærmest uforstyrret. De fleste gjenstandene som er gravd ned med Tutankhamun har vært godt oppbevart, inkludert flere 1000 gjenstander laget fra edelmetaller og sjeldne steiner.
mt: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "Boy King", is one of the most famous Egyptian kings from ancient Egypt. Interestingly, he was not considered important in antiquity and was not mentioned on most older king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many of the tombs had been looted in the past, this tomb was again almost undisturbed. Most of the objects buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including several 1000 objects made from precious metals and rare stones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Vi har kjennskap med mange greske politikere, forskere og musikere. Den mest kjente personen fra denne kulturen er mest sannsynlig Homer, den legendariske, blinde dikteren, som komponerte to av mesterverkene som finnes i gresk litteratur: diktene Iliad og Odyssey. Sofokles og Aristofanes er fortsatt populære dramatikere, og deres skuespill blir ansett for å være blant de største verkene i verdenslitteraturen. En annen berømt greker er matematikeren Pytagoras, han er mest kjent for den berømte teorien om forholdet mellom sidene i en rettvinklet trekant.
mt: We are familiar with many Greek politicians, scientists and musicians. The most famous person from this culture is most likely Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two of the greatest works that exist in Greek literature: the epics Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights, and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works in world literature. Another famous Greek is the mathematician Pythagoras, he is best known for the famous theory of the relationship between the sides of a right triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Hus var ikke så essensielt i det høy-tempererte klimaet i Midtøsten. Den hebraiske familien levde for det meste ute i det fri. Kvinnene foretok matlagingen i hagen; butikker var kun åpne disker som pekte ut mot gaten. Husene ble bygd av stein. Det var ingen store skoger i landområdene rundt Canaan noe som gjorde at treverket var ekstremt dyrt.
mt: Houses were not so essential in the high-temperate climate of the Middle East. The Hebrew family lived mostly outdoors. The women did the cooking in the yard; shops were only open counters that pointed out to the street. The houses were built of stone. There were no large forests in the areas around Canaan which made wood extremely expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
